page.title: 07Bardon Hill Quarry
page.content: Opened in 1854, the{quarry}now provides work for 123 people, although it used to be 700 before the introduction of specialist machinery. The quarry produces 5,000-6,000 tons of stone per day, ranging from 5cm pieces to a fine dust.{Blasting}takes place about three times a week. The quarry has permission to operate for another fifty years.The quarry owns about 200 {vehicles}of different types for transporting, dumping, digging, lifting and compressing. The drivers need special training to drive the vehicles. Most of the stone is transported by{road}but 15% goes by {rail.}There is a railway siding up to the quarry. My house is in front of the railway. The old steam loco called Black Bess is now in a museum but a diesel called the Duke of Edinburgh now pulls the trucks up the line.
